<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/12/boeings-new-ceo-readies-bumpy-tenure?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
David Calhoun’s Onboarding Deck at Boeing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt='Plain white background with the word "help" in black text.' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4ODQ3NTMyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>He's fine. Everything's fine.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This morning, David Calhoun begins his tenure as chief executive of Boeing, a company in crisis.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Five-second bio: </strong></span><span>Calhoun’s held </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/23/what-to-know-about-new-boeing-ceo-david-calhoun.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">executive roles</a></span><span> at GE, Nielsen, and Blackstone, earning a reputation as a turnaround specialist. He’s served on Boeing’s board for 10 years.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But no amount of experience can prepare you for this to-do list.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Task #1: Get the 737 Max flying again </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Boeing’s bestselling plane has been grounded since March after being involved in two crashes in five months that killed 346 people. Unable to adequately fix the software problem linked to those tragedies, Boeing decided in December to <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-50817124?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">temporarily halt production</a> of the plane, a decision that affects numerous suppliers plus the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-boeing-737max-economy/boeings-737-production-halt-could-dent-u-s-first-quarter-gdp-idUSKBN1YL286?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entire U.S. economy</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last Friday, Boeing supplier Spirit AeroSystems, the largest employer in Wichita, KS, said it would </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/930574810f993a6590190da74a3e4757?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lay off</a></span><span> 2,800 employees due to the 737 Max’s production issues.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If he can get the 737 Max safely in the air again, Calhoun will receive a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/business/boeing-dennis-muilenburg-severance.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$7 million bonus</a>...but the symbolism would be much greater than any dollar amount.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Task #2: Repair Boeing’s reputation </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Reports emerging from the 737 Max crisis have revealed a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/business/boeing-737-employees-messages.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">culture</a> at Boeing that prioritized speed over safety. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest revelation: </strong>Last week, the company released a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/09/business/boeing-737-messages.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mountain of internal communications</a> that showed some employees were aware of flaws in the 737 Max but hid those issues from regulators.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“This airplane is designed by clowns, who are in turn supervised by monkeys,” one Boeing employee wrote of the Max in 2017. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After attending a presentation the company gave to regulators in 2015, another employee said, “it was like dogs watching TV.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>To turn around one of America’s mightiest companies, Calhoun will need to restore trust with the public, lawmakers, and rank-and-file employees while establishing a healthier relationship with the FAA, the U.S.’ powerful aviation regulator.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/12/manhattan-faces-glut-unsold-luxury-apartments?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No One Is Buying New York’s Luxury Condos
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ultra-skinny skyscraper in NYC" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjYwL3VsdHJhLXNraW5ueV9za3lzY3JhcGVyX2luX255Yy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Epistola8, 432 Park Avenue, NY, CC BY-SA 4.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Almost half of the new condos that have come to market in Manhattan since 2015 are <a href="http://www.nancypackesinc.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/A-Tale-Of-Two-Cycles.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">currently unsold</a>, according to Nancy Packes Data Services. The other half are presumably WeWorks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The reason for all the empty mansions-in-the-sky: a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/realestate/new-york-decade-real-estate.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concoction</a> of overly ambitious pricing and worsening sentiment. But mostly pricing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just compare the prices of new development units to resale units over the last decade. In 2012, the difference in the average price between a new and resale unit was 22%. At the end of last year, the premium was 118%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nancy Packes lists three reasons for the “extraordinary oddity of the current cycle.”  </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Buildings competed to add the latest amenities, pushing up prices.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Units grew in size.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The clientele changed. The ultra-skinny towers are trying to woo not just your local billionaire, but the wealthiest people in the world.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>At the current pace, it would take <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-06/manhattan-s-flood-of-new-condos-could-take-six-years-to-sell?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">six years</a> to sell all of Manhattan’s unsold units, per a Halstead Development Marketing report cited by Bloomberg.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/12/us-china-agree-semiannual-economic-talks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
U.S. and China Talks Are About to Get a Lot More Boring
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Design featuring a Chinese ship and U.S. ship reaching toward each other in the middle to signify union" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4ODQ2Mzg0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which...could potentially stop trade wars before they start.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The White House and Beijing have agreed to hold semiannual discussions over economic issues, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/washington-beijing-agree-to-new-dialogue-to-pursue-reforms-address-disputes-11578745800?mod=hp_lead_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports the WSJ</a>. Once resisted by the Trump administration, the talks will implement a <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/495d266c-34b0-11ea-a6d3-9a26f8c3cba4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">similar structure</a> to those put in place by Presidents George W. Bush and Barack Obama. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What do negotiators hope to accomplish? Let’s check in with former Treasury Secretary Hank Paulson, who initiated the economic talks during the Bush administration.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Paulson wrote that his Strategic Economic Dialogue (SED) led to contracts for U.S. companies.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He also argued that as a result of the SED, the U.S. persuaded China </span><span><em>not</em></span><span> to sell its stockpile of U.S. government bonds during the financial crisis in 2009. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Though certain sectors—auto parts, furniture, and machinery—were dinged by tariffs, “<span>most of the U.S. economy sailed through two turbulent years of trade war with China with barely a scratch</span>,” a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trade-war-with-china-took-toll-on-u-s-but-not-big-one-11578832381?mod=hp_lead_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ analysis</a> of economic indicators concludes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, the U.S. and China are expected to sign a “phase one” trade deal that puts future tariffs on hold.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LUXURY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/12/meet-worlds-newest-luxury-brand-harry-meghan?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When Royals Get Kicked off the Family Plan
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4ODQ2MzY4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Geoff Pugh—WPA Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, said they’re stepping away as senior royals and working “to become <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-51060975?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">financially independent</a>,” two things happened:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Netflix rejoiced at the possibility of Meghan playing herself in </span><span><em>The Crown</em></span><span> season 5.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A new luxury brand was born.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Break it down: </strong>Harry and Meghan get 95% of their income from Harry’s father. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Prince of Wales </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/explainers-51047186?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">foots the bill</a></span><span> for public duties and some private costs using money from the Duchy of Cornwall, an investment portfolio that earned $28.2 million last year.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2018–2019, Harry and Meghan got about $6.5 million. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That just went poof. But in December, Harry and Meghan trademarked the “Sussex Royal” brand, which could reportedly make them up to <a href="https://news.sky.com/story/harry-and-meghan-brand-sussex-could-make-absolute-fortune-experts-say-11905372?dcmp=snt-sf-twitter&utm_source=t.co&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">500 million pounds</a>/year if they play their influencer cards right.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>experts speculate the ex-senior royals could lend their brand to TV/film production, public speaking, and a book deal. The 2017 book deal Barack and Michelle Obama signed is estimated to be worth more than $60 million...or 10x Harry’s old allowance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Influencer reality check:</strong> The Sussex Royal Instagram account has just over 10 million followers. Soccer star Cristiano Ronaldo has almost 200 million. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F01%2F12%2Fmeet-worlds-newest-luxury-brand-harry-meghan" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY WHOOP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Let’s Check in With Our CEO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.whoop.com/restolution/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=RESTolutions&utm_content=Jan13_Top" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Whoop" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTgwNzY4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Readers, you may remember that our fearless leader, Morning Brew CEO/Cofounder Alex Lieberman, recently started getting more sleep.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He’s focusing on his rest and recovery, and he’s doing it with <a href="https://www.whoop.com/restolution/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=RESTolutions&utm_content=Jan13_PrimaryBody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a>—<strong style="color:#000">the world’s most powerful performance tool</strong>. Luckily for our purposes, he’s created a Slack channel just for me and him called “SuperLieberMan.” I get minute-by-minute updates on Alex’s sleep habits (in bed by 10:30) and his workout schedule (6 days a week, show-off).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But I also know he’s seeing real results by <a href="https://www.whoop.com/restolution/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=RESTolutions&utm_content=Jan13_PrimaryBody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">committing to his #RESTolution</a> by doubling down on high-quality sleep and rest in order to be the best version of himself. <strong style="color:#000">As a member of the community, he’s getting all the support he needs: A free WHOOP Strap 3.0, 24/7 real-time analytics, and premier membership services.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like most CEOs (and the copywriter flunkies who make them look good), Alex is busy, but <a href="https://www.whoop.com/restolution/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=RESTolutions&utm_content=Jan13_PrimaryBody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a> makes it easy for him to rest, recover, and most importantly, perform. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stick to your #RESTolutions. <a href="https://www.whoop.com/restolution/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=Newsletter&utm_campaign=RESTolutions&utm_content=Jan13_PrimaryCTA" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Become a WHOOP member, like Alex, today</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earnings, trade deals, loads of economic data...holiday break seems a distant memory. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>IRS quarterly tax filing deadline day; the U.S. and China sign “phase one” trade deal; earnings (Bank of America, BlackRock, Goldman Sachs, UnitedHealth, U.S. Bancorp, PNC Financial, Alcoa) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Religious Freedom Day; earnings (Morgan Stanley, Taiwan Semiconductor, BNY Mellon, Charles Schwab); retail sales </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Consumer sentiment; iHeartRadio Podcast Awards</p>

Everything's fine.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis morning, David Calhoun begins his tenure as chief executive of Boeing, a company in crisis.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFive-second bio: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCalhoun’s held \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/23/what-to-know-about-new-boeing-ceo-david-calhoun.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexecutive roles\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at GE, Nielsen, and Blackstone, earning a reputation as a turnaround specialist. He’s served on Boeing’s board for 10 years.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut no amount of experience can prepare you for this to-do list.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTask #1: Get the 737 Max flying again \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoeing’s bestselling plane has been grounded since March after being involved in two crashes in five months that killed 346 people. Unable to adequately fix the software problem linked to those tragedies, Boeing decided in December to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-50817124?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etemporarily halt production\u003c/a\u003e of the plane, a decision that affects numerous suppliers plus the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-boeing-737max-economy/boeings-737-production-halt-could-dent-u-s-first-quarter-gdp-idUSKBN1YL286?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eentire U.S. economy\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast Friday, Boeing supplier Spirit AeroSystems, the largest employer in Wichita, KS, said it would \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/930574810f993a6590190da74a3e4757?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elay off\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 2,800 employees due to the 737 Max’s production issues.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf he can get the 737 Max safely in the air again, Calhoun will receive a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/business/boeing-dennis-muilenburg-severance.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$7 million bonus\u003c/a\u003e...but the symbolism would be much greater than any dollar amount.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTask #2: Repair Boeing’s reputation \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eReports emerging from the 737 Max crisis have revealed a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/business/boeing-737-employees-messages.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eculture\u003c/a\u003e at Boeing that prioritized speed over safety. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest revelation: \u003c/strong\u003eLast week, the company released a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/09/business/boeing-737-messages.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emountain of internal communications\u003c/a\u003e that showed some employees were aware of flaws in the 737 Max but hid those issues from regulators.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“This airplane is designed by clowns, who are in turn supervised by monkeys,” one Boeing employee wrote of the Max in 2017. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter attending a presentation the company gave to regulators in 2015, another employee said, “it was like dogs watching TV.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eTo turn around one of America’s mightiest companies, Calhoun will need to restore trust with the public, lawmakers, and rank-and-file employees while establishing a healthier in Manhattan since 2015 are \u003ca href=\"http://www.nancypackesinc.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/A-Tale-Of-Two-Cycles.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" The other half are presumably WeWorks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe reason for all the empty mansions-in-the-sky: a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/realestate/new-york-decade-real-estate.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcoction\u003c/a\u003e of overly ambitious pricing and worsening sentiment. But mostly pricing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust compare the prices of new development units to resale units over the last decade. In 2012, the difference in the average price between a new and resale unit was 22%. At the end of last year, the premium was 118%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNancy Packes lists three reasons for the “extraordinary oddity of the current cycle.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBuildings competed to add the latest amenities, pushing up prices.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnits grew in size.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe clientele changed. The ultra-skinny towers are trying to woo not just your local billionaire, but the wealthiest people in the world.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAt the current pace, it would take \u003ca Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich...could potentially stop trade wars before they start.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe White House and Beijing have agreed to hold semiannual discussions over economic issues, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/washington-beijing-agree-to-new-dialogue-to-pursue-reforms-address-disputes-11578745800?mod=hp_lead_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. Once resisted by the Trump administration, the talks will implement a \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/495d266c-34b0-11ea-a6d3-9a26f8c3cba4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esimilar structure\u003c/a\u003e to those put in place by Presidents George W. Bush and Barack Obama. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat do negotiators hope to accomplish? Let’s check in with former Treasury Secretary Hank Paulson, who initiated the economic talks during the Bush administration.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePaulson wrote that his Strategic Economic Dialogue (SED) led to contracts for U.S. companies.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe also argued that as a result of the SED, the U.S. persuaded China \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to sell its stockpile of U.S. government bonds during the financial crisis in 2009. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Though certain sectors—auto parts, furniture, and machinery—were dinged by tariffs, “\u003cspan\u003emost of the U.S. economy sailed through two turbulent years of trade style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNetflix rejoiced at the possibility of Meghan playing herself in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Crown\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e season 5.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA new luxury brand was \u003c/strong\u003eHarry and Meghan get 95% of their income from Harry’s father. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Prince of Wales \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca investment portfolio that earned $28.2 million last year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018–2019, Harry and Meghan got about $6.5 million. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat just went poof. But in December, Harry and Meghan trademarked the “Sussex Royal” brand, which could reportedly make them up to \u003ca href=\"https://news.sky.com/story/harry-and-meghan-brand-sussex-could-make-absolute-fortune-experts-say-11905372?dcmp=snt-sf-twitter\u0026utm_source=t.co\u0026utm_medium=referral\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e500 million pounds\u003c/a\u003e/year if they play their influencer cards right.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eexperts speculate the ex-senior royals could lend their brand to TV/film production, public speaking, and a book deal. The 2017 book deal Barack and Michelle Obama signed is estimated to be worth more than $60 million...or 10x Harry’s old allowance.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Influencer reality check:\u003c/strong\u003e The Sussex Royal Instagram account has just over 10 million followers.
